block_comment: This block of code determines the next state of the `firq_not_user_mode_nxt` signal. It does so by performing a logical AND operation on the inverted state of `user_mode_regs_load_nxt` and a check if `status_bits_mode_nxt` equals to `FIRQ`. The `firq_not_user_mode_nxt` signal thus will be high only if `user_mode_regs_load_nxt` is low (not in user mode) and `status_bits_mode_nxt` indicates a Fast Interrupt Request (FIRQ) mode, reflecting the implementation's leveraged hardware interrupt priorities and modes.
